A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Beautiful visuals and great actors cannot hide the lack of substance of this entry into the Star Wars Universe. A jarring second act\, an absolute absence of character development\, awkward jokes that you usually hear in Michael Bay's movies and a confused effort to try and bring new political themes into the lore\, leave the moviegoer only with one last hope: that Episode IX will at least try to be a good movie. In the end\, the movie does not have any consequence for the development of this franchise\, for better or worse. The so-called \"bold choices\" are limited to gimmicky twists and try to deter from the fact that this is unfortunately a very boring movie in itself that leaves no excitement for what's to come.
